DOC.detailed_description: Primary research question : For pregnant woman non-severe , non-proteinuric maternal hypertension 14-33 week , 'less tight ' control ( target diastolic blood pressure [ dBP ] 100 mmHg ) versus 'tight ' control ( target dBP 85 mmHg ) increase ( decrease ) likelihood pregnancy loss Neonatal Intensive Care Unit ( NICU ) admission great 48 hour ? Secondary research question : Will 'less tight ' versus 'tight ' control increase ( decrease ) likelihood serious maternal complication ? Other research question : Will 'less tight ' versus 'tight ' control : 1 . Increase ( decrease ) likelihood serious perinatal complication ? 2 . Increase ( decrease ) likelihood severe hypertension pre-eclampsia ? 3 . Increase ( decrease ) likelihood maternal satisfaction care ? 4 . Result significant change dBP health care cost ? Treatment Allocation : Eligible woman randomise centrally either 'less tight ' control ( aim dBP 100mmHg ) 'tight ' control ( aim dBP 85mmHg ) hypertension . Randomisation stratify centre type hypertension ( pre-existing gestational ) . - In 'less tight ' control group , dBP ≥105mmHg , antihypertensive medication must start increase dose . - In 'tight ' control group , dBP ≤80mmHg , antihypertensive medication must decrease dose discontinue . - In group , centre provide usual care . Data collect potential co-interventions ( e.g. , hospitalisation , bedrest ) . Outcomes : Primary : Pregnancy loss ( miscarriage ectopic pregnancy , pregnancy termination , stillbirth , neonatal death ) high level neonatal care > 48 hour first 28 day life prior primary hospital discharge , whichever later . Secondary : One/more serious maternal complication ( ) six week postpartum . Follow-up : Compliance ( dBP antihypertensive dose ) assess within 4 week randomisation . Outcome data collect woman 's ( baby 's ) hospital stay birth ( loss ) . Women contact 6 12 week delivery ( loss ) , preterm baby , baby 36 week correct gestational age enquire satisfaction care major maternal/neonatal morbidity follow hospital discharge .
